review: Used to be a family fave. Most recent visit was awful!! The food, service & even sodas were all terrible!! After our meal I spoke with a manager about our experience. He couldn't have cared less. Told we were regular customers & had come to dinner that night because it was my daughter's Birthday & she wanted Chili's. He said, " give me your name screws & email address & I'll see what I can do".  That was two months ago -  I've had no response!! Is customer service a thing of the past?!

This Chili's is like every other Chili's that was ever a Chili's. If you know you like Chili's, then this Chili's will certainly meet your expectations. I only came here because my friend had a gift certificate, but definitely clocked in a lot of happy hours at Chili's when I was younger and lived in a town with significantly less choices. If you are looking for a happy hour, I would say the happy hour here is decent but they have a minimal beer selection. They do have a good selection of liquor and obvs have the margaritas they would like to be known for, so you'll be in business if either of those things appeal to you. In my personal opinion, the noise level can get a little obnoxious from the TVs, but I'm a big stick in the mud who doesn't care about watching sports while I drink. I was able to read a book while I waited for my friend, but it took some extra powers of concentration which would be hard to maintain after a drink or two. I am now realizing that I sound like a grumpy old lady, but I have decided to blame Chili's for that.

As I sit at the peak of Mount Texas, I have been taught to stay in the moment. Consider all things. Life. Existence. Death. The grand circus.  We exist in this world as a temporary shadow in the tripping of eternity. Everything we do, own, create, build and love is all borrowed from fleeting moments. I take a breath. And another. Another.  And I see balance in the cosmos.  Ying cannot exist without yang.  From the blackness comes the light. Everything is relative and Universal Law works never-ending balancing it all. As I see a hawk circle above looking for prey, I realize something more than profound: Chili's is the nexus of all restaurants.  It is designed to please the most people, regardless of race or nationality.  Their menu is derived from a law of averages considering all ingredients and recipes by popularity. And it very well could be God's favorite restaurant. Of course, in a world of infinite harmony, no dish is stand out or spectacular; That would disturb natural order.  Don't expect a meal you'll either hate or love. At Chili's it's simple: You go in hungry. You go out full.  Universal balance achieved.

The bartender named Ivania is rude.  Corp. office did little to address the issue.  Instead of a genuine apology for her rude behavior and completely ignoring my boyfriend and I (we eventually just sat in the dining area to get away from her) they sent two $5 gift certificates.    One server there, Beto, is great though!  He makes up for the fact that mgmt. allows Ivania to continue her obnoxious ways.  Now when we go, I call ahead to make sure she's not working at that time.  That is how bad we were treated by her.  Oh and I can't even forget the fact that she also over-charged us.  Fortunately, the manager did take care of that issue.

My friend and I went back there again.  Ordered those Crispy tenders.. I ordered the dijon, but I should had got it without the stuff on it.  My friend kept having to ask the waiter to bring stuff.. Silverware, butter, etc.  I think they were understaff during lunch.  The mango tea did not taste the same.. (didn't taste good at all).

Great service! Awesome food!  Me and my friend came here for dinner after my flight. I am no Texas-ian, so it was a completely new experience for me that you actually get your app to eat before your entree. This silly thing is rare for high pace New York. The simple differences just amaze me. But I really loved their nachos dip, cheesey meat sauce with a bit of a kick. I ordered steak as my entree and it was great :)

Good drinks, good food, good service.  All in all a solid mid-value restaurant.  Also, I'm going back tomorrow because getting awful margaritas elsewhere (see my review of the Venetian theater) makes me want to come here for a good one. :)

I like Chili's. I usually get the same thing, the Honey Chipotle Chicken Crispers. If I do dessert, I do the skillet cookie a al mode. Mmm Mmm Good. That's pretty much what I had today.  Service was very mediocre. It seemed like the employees were in drag mode. It was a lot of chillin' and not enough table waiting. It was not bad enough for me to never go back but they do not get the customer service award for the day.

I enjoy Chili's. The chicken enchilada soup is delicious, and the skillet queso is one of my favorite things ever. I almost always get the Monterey chicken, and I have since I was a youngun. The food here is consistent with other Chili's restaurants I've been to, but overall it's just very meh. The service is okay but not great.

Slowest service ever.  Food is typical Chili's but it shouldn't take over 5 minutes to take a drink order. Then another 10 to get the drinks. Just a reminder for waiters, bring your guests water if the order a special beverage.

My new neighborhood! Decided to drop in for lunch. My experience was great. The place was clean and the customer service was excellent! Diana was our waitress and I was so impressed with the level of service she provided. I opted for the southwest chicken salad and it was very balanced, tasteful and hit all the right spots. I foresee this being my go to spot for salads.

The worst restaurant experience I have had in a very long time.  It took 5 minutes to get a menu, 15 minutes to get water (after I asked the hostess to bring it to us) 20 minutes to get our soup (they don't need to cook that do they? just scoop it out of a pot) and after 45 minutes we left without getting our lunch. We arrived with our almost 2 year old.  We ordered and then waited.  It wasn't particularly busy but I waited close to 10 minutes and didn't see a waiter or waitress in the section we were ONCE, even though there were 8 tables with people at them.  Since I asked the hostess to get us water she let the manager know.  He stopped by shortly after our waitress apologized but said that she wanted to get out meal in the computer right away so we wouldn't have to wait.  The manager apologized and mentioned something about taking care of us.   After getting our soups, which weren't bad, we waited, and waited and waited.  After 25 minutes we gave up.  Luckily, our flight was delayed, because between the 45 minute non-lunch and all the construction in and around the airport, we definitely would have been late. I think the most disappointing part of the experience was the waitress who didn't take responsibility and the manager who said he would take care of us, but failed miserably to follow through.   I only pray that corporate reads yelp reviews, but based on the staff we ran into there, I doubt it.

Service is slow and servers have a attitude. Orders came out wrong. Had to ask management to get refills. This Chili's is not one to go to. It was busy when we got here but service died down as fast as the customer count did. When full, service was fast. When place was 1/4 full, service took 5x longer.

I went to this Chili's this past Saturday night.  We got there at like 7pm and there was no one waiting in the waiting area. The hostess did tell us that the only booth she had available was in the bar area. At first we were apprehensive because we didn't want to get lousy service but figured what the heck. So we are seated in the bar area and wait.  We sat there for a good 10 mins before any server was to be seen. I asked my bf if there was even a server in this area and he said yes I have seen one lady. So this lady finally gets over to us and proceeds to tell us how her and Jennifer would be helping us this evening. Ha that's a funny one. We ask for 2 waters and ask her if it is OK to place our order since we had a feeling she wouldn't be back for a while. She says of course. So we decide on the two for $20 deal with the appetizer. We order the flat-bread as the appetizer and I order the Margarita Grilled Chicken entree which I have had several times.  We then sit there and wait. No drinks to be had for 30 mins!!! Are you kidding me?  Still noticing that our server is the only one working in this area. Where is her sidekick Jennifer?  So finally my bf gets up and goes to the hostess and explains to her that we still haven't even gotten our drinks. She looks at him like she doesn't understand English and then says I'll let my manager know.  Finally the hostess comes and plops down 2 waters. A few minutes later the manager comes over carrying our entrees. He apologizes for the wait and places them on the table. I thank him but also mention that we had ordered an appetizer. He says Oh I am sorry, let me go check on it. So now we proceed to eat out food. First bite into my chicken and it is cold! Ugh. Then I realize that there is no rice on my plate! Just black beans a piece of grilled chicken and some pico. Are you kidding me??? I pull out the menu just to double check that they didn't take the rice out of this dish but there it is in writing and in the picture. So finally about 10 mins later the server comes by to apologize to us about our flat-bread. She said somehow it got lost in the kitchen. Um OK. I then tell her that I didn't get any rice. She apologizes again and says let me get you some.  A few mins later she comes back to say that they have run out of rice. Wow!! So you don't tell anyone when they are ordering dishes that come with rice?? I would have ordered something else. This entire dining experience was a disaster! So now are done and I am barely full. The manager comes over and says that he is so sorry for all the mess ups this evening and proceeds to tell us that there is no charge. (Um there better not be!!) He then also says that we can sit here and wait for our flat-bread to come out but he doesn't think that it is coming. He said he believes it had fell on the floor. Um what?? I then asked, so our 2nd pizza was made but then it fell on the floor? He says yes. I am so sorry. LOL!!! Wow!! That is all I can say!

I frequent Chili's but need to make you aware that the Market Street location in Irving, Texas has to have the absolutely worst service that I've experienced.  It takes forever to get your food (simple things like chips and guacamole).  It took 24 minutes to get our appetizer.  Don't eat here because the service is terrible.
Just like any other Chili's i've been to: Great food for a great price... but service sucks.  I have no idea why service in every Chili's i've been to is slow, unfriendly or both.

Nothing good nothing bad just your average eatery... This place stays busy! Even on a random Tuesday there is a wait. Our order is always correct but its just not anything special about the food or service...

I had a flight to SFO with a 2 1/2 layover in Dallas. My friend picked me up and we stopped here to get something to eat.  Only drawback was that the restaurant was not very clean, food and stuff on the floor. But otherwise everything was good. The food was good (we ordered tripple dipper with chicken crispers and egg rolls, and a chicken sandwich to go) and our server Jennifer was very nice. When I mentioned that I was on a time limit and that I needed to get catch a flight, she made sure she brought the meal promptly. She was very attentive and efficient with our requests for to-go boxes and sauce containers. We paid the bill using the kiosk at the table.  Efficient, good service and a good meal.

We used to go to this Chili's location all the time for a quick drink and dinner or to take the kids to teach them how to act in a restaurant.  For some reason, the service got worse and worse.  The straw that broke the camel's back on us going there was one night a few months ago when we showed up with our kids. We were told we could only sit in the bar because they didn't have ANY waitstaff for the night.  We normally don't mind sitting in the bar, but when we have our kids with us, we would rather sit in the dining area.  We turned around and have never been back.

I haven't had Chili's in a good long while, so I decided to drop in to this location in North Irving and max out the $25 gift card I got for recycling plastic bottles. Anyways, after donating blood, I went and ordered the custom triple dipper and the Southern Smokehouse burger for lunch. The service was great, the staff was very friendly and the food & drink was brought promptly to the table (5 minutes, give or take). Plus the food was cooked to perfection. It was too bad that my eyes were once again bigger than my stomach, not taking into account the earlier snack I had as I recover after donating blood. LOL! Thankfully, I get to take the stuff home. Despite what the "negative" reviews say, the service is as good as it gets. While this isn't those fancy gourmet hundred/thousand-dollar-per-dish restaurants, you can get great food within your budget. I'll definitely return to Chili's in another time. If for nothing else, a family get together.

Terrible lunch experience..The negative reviews are spot on..the bartender/waitress was incredibly rude and snotty. Came up to us and uttered " What do you want" Didn't ask me if we wanted appetizers..nothing. The lunch portion fajitas are a joke..5 pieces of chicken...She asked me "soup or salad"? I said salad and asked her "What dressings do you have?"  She's like..What do you like? That's not the question i asked you...Someone else had to get our appetizers...since she forgot about it....never again...

They are under new management and it shows. Food is Chilis but it's hot and fresh and simply perfect. If you haven't been here in a while you should give them a shot. This locations has great tv's and surround sound for sports games and the bartenders are really friendly.  This is the spot in Valley Ranch for a fast hot lunch as well as on weekends for football games.

If I could give 0 stars I would. These people are extremely rude and have absolutely no customer service skills. My husband and I walked in at 7pm on a Sunday night and it wasn't busy yet because the hostess was waiting for a table to be ready with the 10 person group in front of us she just stood there looking at our party of 2. I finally had to ask if anyone was hosting because she just stood there doing nothing for so long and she rudely told me she would "deal" with me when the large group in front of me had been seated. There were tons of tables available and so I turned to my husband and asked if he wanted to spend our money elsewhere and the hostess didn't even seem phased while about 3 waiters watched the whole thing not helping either. Another smaller group came in behind us and asked what was going on so we told them we were not being treated well so we were leaving. She must have been rude to them too because while I was getting in my car I saw that small party walk out too. I am shocked by this whole experience as other Chili's locations have been good choices in the past. I warn you, avoid this Chili's with the lazy rude hostess and apathetic staff at all costs. Spend your hard earned money somewhere that will respect you.
So-so experience some food came to the table needing to be reheated. very good service. TK was excellent!!

Had an all around great experience. Got here the night before a conference and was looking for a satisfying, easy, good meal. Was not disappointed. TK is awesome and probably the best waiter I've had in my life. Food was great!  My favorite thing on the menu is the Smokehouse Burger. It's the kind of burger that is large, flavorful, juicy and delicious as "insert here." They have great Arnold palmers!

Have given these guys too many chances. Everytime we go SOMETHING goes wrong.  Everything from cold food to getting our order wrong to rude servers. I recommend to drive just a few more minutes and go to the one in Irving by Hwy 183 Airport fwy. We have NEVER had an issue at that location.
Good food! My roommate worked there and says she does not have any nasty secrets about the food! They are very clean, and follow all the rules. I loooove the bacon cheese fries!
The service was terrible. We were never checked on, drinks sat empty, waited forever to get approached. Won't come back.

Stopped to have a beer and something to eat. Place was pretty empty for 6:00 should have been my first clue. Sat at the bar with 3 others and barkeep said he would be right with me. Served drinks to a table and went in the back 2 others arrived, a couple of minutes past and barkeep came back with a box of money, opened it started counting it put it back in the box said I'll be right back and again went to the back.  I did not wait any longer   Razzoo's is next door and the service was spot on.

The food is fine but the service here still lags. Orders taken and drinks delivered okay but had to ask for ordered chips and salsa appetizer after meal was delivered. Then waiter, distracted by other tables perhaps, went missing and his alleged partner was never sighted. 20 minutes after asking for napkins, seeing neither Josh nor any refills, another waiter came to clear our table! No, we were not done. Our cups and bowls were empty but "bottomless" soup should come with at least ONE refill before hustling us along. Getting a manager's attention improved things dramatically but the damage was done. Other waiters filled in until the end of the meal and Josh did not reappear until after the check was paid. He offered an excuse and a semi-apology but it will be quite a while before we give this location another chance to let us down.

I can always depend on Chili's for a basic American food dinner. The food is what you expect it to be...but this visit was awesome due to the service. The server (Jeff) was super awesome and attentive. He was on top of our order, our requests and very friendly overall. He clearly enjoyed his job and it showed with his positive energy. I had my nieces with me and he made sure they had refills without asking and even got them a to go refill. This was a very pleasant Sunday night dinner with the family.

chili's is the go to spot 4 a good quick hh special & football watching!! we were sitting at the bar and the lady that was waiting on us was greatness...but unfortunately, she had to leave!! so the bartender just neglected us....horribly!!! it wasn't until i said something to the manager that we got a tad bit better service. the food & everything else was good...just the neglect i couldn't do!

Just had a awful experience! This Chili's is filthy! I can't even describe how bad it was. Not sure if I'll be able to visit this location again. I took pics so I could prove it. I'll try and post. I left feeling sick to my stomach because of the filth.

So I ordered the "NEW" Top Shelf Beef Short Rib enchiladas.  And they don't carry them anymore. .. So then I ordered the Smokehouse Burger. .. there's always option B right. The restaurant seems clean to me.  My server was right on top of things and checked on me a few times to make sure everything was good even before my food came out.  Let's see how everything turns out.
Ive been here many times and the service is always great! im not sure why there are so many negative comments about the  service

If I may be really honest, Chili's is only worth going to if you get a gift card for your birthday or Christmas. Lately, that is the only reason I go to this Chili's. The beer is always cold. The drinks suck (measure, measure, measure) and the service is below average. There are better value price restaurants out there.

Horrible service. Poor quality food and bad attitudes. Ask very politely for some fresh French frys and got Attitude. Chicken was overlooked and soggy. Corn was boiled to death. My fresh French frys where refried and were very hard, dry and old. Will never come back, even though I live 1 mile away.  Most airport locations have a higher quality of food then this place.  STAY AWAY.
Slow service. I had the Old Timer with Cheese, it was over cooked and dry. The onion rings were good though.
We like this Chili's. Go if you have enough time, not at lunch break, but for a dinner out its a great place to go.

It's hard to want to eat food at a restaurant that still has other people's dishes on the tables and bar. Sat at the bar for 15 minutes and watched three different customers ask for the same thing; to have their area of the bar cleaned prior to ordering a drink. Is it just me or should a clean surface be a prerequisite for dining at an establishment?! I wish Chilis would actually read their reviews so they could fix their issues!

Before I go in on this Chili's, I want people to know that I understand this is a chain restaurant, and I really don't expect 5 star service. However, this place doesn't even give 1 star service. The servers are terrible. I have never had a good experience with any servers here. The bartender, I forget his name, is especially terrible. His main concern is flirting with the girls who come in instead of actually making drinks. The food is always cold and old-tasting. I keep giving them chance after chance, but they ALWAYS disappoint. Btw, I love Chili's. It's probably one of my fave chains to eat at, but I refuse to dine at this Chili's. I could live with the poor service if the food made up for it, but it doesn't. Never coming here again.
Nice place to have dinner with family.  Comfortable atmosphere and good food.
Not a single order was correct and no manager voluntarily came to correct or explain the mistakes. We even had to ask multiple times for part of the order to be brought out. Worst service ever.
Burgers was good, service was very slow. Especially since it's right out of the holidays and there wasn't that many customers present.

Hubby and I headed here to eat brunch after a trip to Fort Worth. I had fish tacos (which I didn't enjoy); trying to select better foods that are not fried): Hubby had the new loaded boneless wings (they were loaded with cheese, and, Oh, no, jalapeños - Hubby don't do jalapeños). Sounds like a bad experience, but our server, who is new, was quite attentive. Hubby got a salad that I ate (lol). I was offered something else, a different choice of entree, I declined. After nibbling on the fish, my salad and Diet Coke, I was satisfied. Overall, I was impressed with Torian, I wouldn't have known this was his 3rd day if he hadn't mentioned it. Way to go management! And thank you for great customer service.
Horrible service. The waiters are in no rush. Very sad when it is empty and the service is so slow. 2nd time I have come here and will not be back. Do not come on your work break. You will be late.

We've been to this Chili's quite a few times in the past because it's close to my husband's work.  We decided to have lunch here today.  Upon arriving, we were seated quickly.  We looked over our menus for a long time before anyone even came by and said someone would be right with us.  It was probably around five minutes before that happened and almost another five minutes before our actual server showed up.  We ordered a water with no lemon and a coke.  We also ordered a half order of the cheese fries and two entrees on the 2 for $20 menu.  The server, Chris, advised he would put our entrees in a few minutes later so not everything would come to our table at the same time.  We sat for about 10 minutes and no one ever came back over.  NOT EVEN OUR DRINKS!  Another server showed up with our appetizer..still no drinks and now no app plates on which to eat our fries.  A few minutes later, our server showed up with our entrees...still no drinks.  His excuse and the only thing he said was, "I'm sorry.  My manager has me running around like crazy."  That's funny because there was no pep in his step and no sense of urgency at all.  We finally, after all of that, got our drinks.  When we were finished with our lunch, we waited and waited and finally, in the most-polite-as-I-can-be voice, asked another server to bring us some to go boxes.  The hostess walked by at one point, as we were finishing, and offered to get my husband more tea (because he never received a refill and ended up drinking the rest of my water) to which he replied, "It was actually coke but we are about to leave so, no."  We never received a ticket so we just paid on the little kiosk on the table and, even though we still tipped, it was nowhere near like we normally tip.  I must say, this was during the lunch crowd...we arrived at 12:45 p.m.  I did take a survey on the kiosk after paying to let them know that we were extremely disappointed and that the service was horrible.  I don't know that we'll ever go back to that location.  If we do, we will make sure to NOT sit in Chris's section.    Note to the restaurant....a little communication goes a long way and if a manger is running you ragged then the manager ESPECIALLY needs to let the patrons know or at least check on everyone.

Today I had the Margarita Chicken for lunch; it should have included a barf bag. The black beans were fine but the chicken must have been made in a lab with a 3D meat printer. It was like memory foam with zero flavor. I cut a piece and pressed it down to half its size with my fork, which took little effort, and then it slowly grew back to it's original shape. It had the texture of Tofu. I'm 53 and I can honestly say that it was one of the worst and most bizarre food experiences of my life. I'm guessing they get their chicken for this dish from DuPont or Dow. It was a bit fascinating in a disgusting sort of way. It took everything inside of my not to throw it on the floor just to see how high it would bounce. At least the bathroom was clean.
Walk in greeting -check Cold beer- check My favorite dish on point- check Cool a$$ bartender ( Jonathan)-check Treat ya self and stop by this location!!!!

Today I went to Chili's for lunch with a friend. Harold TH was our waiter. I did not catch the managers name however she was a female. When we walked in we saw that there was a issue with the grill being down however most of the menu was still availible. My friend ordered the lunch chicken fajitas and I said I would have the same except I would have beef. The meal was small and we each got 3 shells for our food. They took about double the time it should have taken and the food was bland tasting. We ate the food and were ready to pay when we found out that I was being billed for a dinner meal and on top of that a additonal charge for beef. After the 2nd overcharge I asked for the manager. She showed me several times that the beef does not have a lunch meal to which I responded that is what I ordered though and no one told me it was not a option. They just gave me a dinner cost plate and added 2 additional charges for beef on top of that. I understand wait staff can make a error. We are all human. My main issue was that the manager did nothing about it besides take a 1.50 off a 20$ bill. I told her to leave it and I will pay however I was upset and will not comeback. It's not about the money people. It is about getting ducks in a row and when you mess up make it right. Disappointed!

This location is terrible. I never want to go back. The food is disgusting and service is so, so, soooo bad. My husband and I went for lunch at around 2:30 and there were literally 18 people in the whole restaurant so we figured it would be a quick in and out lunch. Nope. It was awful how long we had to wait for our food. Our server seemed like he hated life. Everything about Chili's suck. I'm never going back.

Sunday at 3:40 .I would give this chilis a 0 star rating  Waited 15 to be seated and it wasn't busy no line no hostess .  We decided to seat our selves and even asked the waited if this was fine to sit in this booth he said yes. Still waited longest time no waiter came , we walked out.i have never written a bad review here on Yelp but this one needed it .

There were barely any customers but the service was way too slow.  Place is filthy and I am not sure why they can't clean it.  This place can be hit or miss and I already had 2/4 misses within last 45 days.

Had a coworker pick me up some lunch from this location and the chicken was not done on the meal I ordered. I called and spoke with Jesse who stated I could come back and get a fresh one on them along with a reimbursement (which makes sense due to the inconvenience of me not being able to have lunch). I get to their location and he doesn't want to reimburse me. Overall I love Chili's but I will never support this location again.

Went in for a quick dinner, and drinks.  Walked in, and waited an awkwardly long time, until someone came from the back, and offered to seat us.   Our waitress was friendly, and attentative throughout, and I have no complaints with her.   Ordered the fried pickle appetizer.  Unfortunately they arrived just before my entree did.  They were very hot, and you could tell they were just prepared, and again unfortunately they were terrible.  They were mushy, and extremely salty. I tried to mask it with dipping sauce, but I couldn't stomach it.  The entree was good, and I can't think of any gripes I had with it.   In the future I'd stop in for drinks, but that's about it.

I will never order food from this place again. I ordered a smothered chicken burrito and it was gross. The rice was hard and the sour cream sauce tasted like it was made from old milk. I feel so bad for having to take it to the chili's close to my house in order to get a new one. Never again. Sticking to the one by my house.

Visited Wed at 5:30 PM. Tried to sit in the 90% empty bar, couldn't get service. Moved to the dining room, 95% empty, had to locate an employee to seat us. Got seated and ordered drinks - water and diet Coke. We were brought water and iced tea. Ordered the same meal chicken Pasilla - wife's was fine, mine was ice cold. They reheated it. Manager came by to say "sorry". Manager offered a lame excuse and went away. Really NO excuse for poor service or bad food when your restaurant is empty.  Manager may want to consider Uber.

Just like all the other reviews, the service at this location is horrible. We sat ourselves in the bar and waited and waited and waited....so we went to the hostess stand to get seated in the dining room. And we waited, and waited and waited.....we were finally seated when my husband walked into the kitchen! The server was apologetic and had our food out quickly. BUT the chicken was COLD. Gross. We won't be back

Not the place to I would recommend to anyone.. when I walked in there was no host to greet me or point me to where I needed to be.. when I picked my food it was cold... not even warm and we picked it up at the time they said it would be.. over all bad experience.. it reminded me why I stopped eating at chili's

Horrible service!!! The only time our server was at our table was to take our order and deliver lemons that we didn't get with our waters. Someone else delivered our water and food. We even ordered something to go and another person brought it out. We sat near the kitchen and could hear EVERYTHING. Staff yelling at the manager, cussing each other out...SO unprofessional. And to top it off, our server double charged us for an item and we had to grab another server to help us. Our server was MIA throughout our dinner and we left without her checking on us. Not once did she ask how our food was. She had an attitude from the beginning and we could tell she didn't want to be there. GET NEW STAFF AND MANAGEMENT! Until then, I will make sure to drive farther to a different Chili's just to get better service.

Order chips and queso. The chips were so grease that were wet.   The queso was cold. We sent back and they brought even worse batch. I order the fajita trio with Cadillac side.  First time I had fajitas that were not sizzling !  Never ever Coming here again !
If I could leave a zero I would.....the worse service I have ever had anywhere-waited 30 minutes and finally left-not that anyone noticed

Went here this afternoon with some co-workers for lunch and the restaurant was an absolute ghost-town for the location and time of day. Upon being seated, the server had mentioned that their POS system that sends orders into the kitchen was down and that at the moment, they were out of tea. As lunch went on, it was evident upon other requests that the staff didn't do their pre-service prep work at all. I used to work for Chili's about 15 years ago, and liked the food so much back then that I'd take some home almost daily. I'm not really sure what happened since then as my chicken fajitas were flavorless and a struggle to eat this afternoon. Other items at the table were Southwestern Egg Rolls, and fried cheese bites..Upon walking out, I quote my coworkers, 'Never again...who do we blame for suggesting this place?'. Next time, I'm going next door.

This restaurant is a joke. There's never anyone at the front. It's always like this, but it's never been this bad. We told them 2 and a high chair and we got seated, though they never brought us that highchair and my daughter was getting frustrated sitting on my lap. We waited 15 min and no one ever came to introduce themselves and offer us the drinks at least. It wasn't even busy as it usually is. People left, waiters cleaned, continued asking other tables if they were okay. We seemed to be invisible. Gave it 5 more min until this couple came in, they got seated and not even 2 minutes after a waitress came to their table..while we just sat there. Shitty service. Never going back there again! I wish I could give 0 stars.

Service was terrible when I ate at this Chilli's a few days ago. The guy at the front of the restaurant seemed like he did NOT want to be working that night. Not to mention the waitress who was VERY rude to everyone at our party. Good thing the manager listened to our complaints about the service and she refunded our meal.

A Chili's is a Chili's, I don't think they can really mess up on the food too bad because really they'll take it back. The food here is what I expect but man does customer service SUCK. went in at 6 on a weekday and waited 10 minutes for anyone to even acknowledge me and my friend. Only when I complained aloud did someone come. Will only go to the one on technology now.

After reading the reviews this was more of a dare for my Wife and I. Cole was our waiter and was pleasantly surprised. Drinks were brought out quick, food was great and service was perfect. Not sure why all the negative reviews but this Chili's deserves 5 stars.

Second time here, dinner service was bad. Order 2 Baby Back Ribs and came out cold & room temperature, we informed the waitress and she stated that it was cooked this morning, wow really and this is dinner time at 7 pm and going to serve us ribs from this morning. Manager came out & explained that they no longer have grill no more and been waiting for over 20 minutes and our food came out, even though he ribs were hot it was not tender as it should be. P.S keep away from ribs for dinner maybe lunch but definitely not dinner.

I really wish I had read the reviews before going to this place!  Went here just before 5 pm and was immediately seated by the bartender, where he directed us to a booth right next to the bar. The music was SO loud and so was the bartender as he yapped to anyone in close proximity. So we asked for seats on the other side of the restaurant. Although there were other patrons seated outside the bar area, the girl who "escorted" us acted like it was a big bother. She sat us at a cramped two-seater behind a ridiculous podium.  My food (Mango Chili Chicken) came out COLD. I tried to let the server know but he raced away so quickly I didn't have the chance. I managed to flag down the manager who was busy giving her undivided attention to one particular table for some reason (a mom, dad and two kids - mom was wearing a Chili's t-shirt - coincidence?) and she simply said "I'll get you a new meal". So I was forced to sit and wait while my companion's food got cold. Unacceptable.   Manager comes back with my food and says she's not leaving until she's "sure the meal is perfect this time" and waited for me to take a bite. I said I didn't expect perfection, just a hot meal. No offer to knock anything off the bill for the inconvenience. Well, this is where things really got ridiculous. The food was so SPICEY I couldn't even eat it. I looked at my companion and we both said ...did she take the food to the kitchen and say that it wasn't "hot" enough so they added more chili? By then I'd had enough. No way was I returning the food to the kitchen twice.   I won't bother coming back to this Chili's or possibly any other Chili's after this fiasco.

Well, what can I say.  I was very impressed with our most recent visit this past Monday evening.  Let me start by saying we have dined here on quite a few occasions and the service has always been less than stellar.  The service is usually slow and the waitstaff is usually not very attentive.  That was NOT the case on this visit.   We had Jasmine as our waitress and she was exceptional!  Not only was she friendly, she was super attentive and made sure our drinks were always full and that we had everything we needed throughout our whole dining experience. One of the items we ordered was the Triple Dipper.  It came to our table with one incorrect item.  Jasmine noticed this and immediately had the kitchen cook up the southwest egg rolls and got them to us within minutes.  We even got to keep the incorrect item. We also ordered the bottomless chips and salsa and when we were ready to leave, she hooked us up with chips and salsa to go. I also noticed the waitstaff crew helping each other out during our entire stay.  It's teamwork like I witnessed that will make a restaurant successful.   All and all I was very happy with this visit. It's clear something changed for the better at this location.  We will definitely be back and will make sure we ask for one of Jasmine's tables.

I went here I a Sunday to watch my beloved 49ers try against the Cowboys  Thank God the burger was delicious I got the old timer with cheese I was so impressed at how well done it was and it had so much flavor I highly recommend it It was only 6.99 and it filled me up I guess they have a special

Chili's is one my favorite food chains in US of A . This place is located at the market place next to On The Border restaurant. Getting to this place is easy on GPS. As we walked in on a Saturday night, seating was very easy on the booth.  We ordered for a couple of margaritas with some Texas Cheese Fries. We also ordered for Salmon and margarita grilled chicken. Texas cheese fries is my favorite appetizer at chilis. The tropical sunset margarita was more like a juice, so if you want something on the liquor side don't go for it. The food items were excellent in taste. Margarita grilled chicken especially was very well made and excellent in taste. Usually Strawberry Lemonade at chilis is very smooth and fresh. The staffs were friendly and inviting.  The only drawback was the price and that the drinks menu was a little weak. In short this outlet was typical chilis outlet where you will enjoy your dinner but make sure you get in with a fat wallet!
